definition: To recognize or establish the identity of someone or something, often by comparing characteristics, traits, or information. It is commonly used in contexts related to crime investigation, personal identification, or verifying the authenticity of an object or document.

examples.german: Die Polizei konnte den Täter identifizieren.
examples.english: The police were able to identify the perpetrator.

examples.german: Es ist wichtig, sich richtig zu identifizieren.
examples.english: It is important to identify oneself correctly.

examples.german: Die Zeugen konnten den Verdächtigen identifizieren.
examples.english: The witnesses were able to identify the suspect.
